snippets.text: Simvastatin-treated patients experienced significantly more reductions in HDRS scores compared to the placebo group by the end of the trial (p=0.02). Early improvement and response rates were significantly greater in the simvastatin group than the placebo group (p=0.02 and p=0.01, respectively) but remission rate was not significantly different between the two groups (p=0.36).
In conclusion, simvastatin seems to be a safe and effective adjuvant therapy for patients suffering from major depressive disorder.
